abstract: Ford reports in regulatory filing that it will be charged $800 million in fourth quarter due to problems with exchanging Venezuelan bolivars and United States dollars, which will reduce quarter's net income by $700 million.
lead_paragraph: Ford said it would take an $800 million charge in the fourth quarter because of exchange rate problems between the Venezuelan currency.
snippet: Ford said it would take an $800 million charge in the fourth quarter because of exchange rate problems between the Venezuelan currency.

headline.main: Venezuelan Currency Problems Dent Ford’s Earnings
headline.print_headline: Venezuelan Currency Problems Dent Ford’s Earnings
